Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2021/0165 b) Date of Occurrence: 10/05/2023
c) Installation Details: Spectre Night - AC-5861-322 at
Base Bravo
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Avionics b) Date Component 12/05/2023
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Mission Computer d) Main Assembly: Rack-Alpha
e) Nomenclature: Mission Computer Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Upgraded
g) Part No.: AV-8596-C5 h) Sl No.: SN-5776-332
i) Firmware Version: FW-5.19.20 j) Software Version: SW-3.96.24
k) Date of Installation: 04/12/2023 l) Date of Removal: 11/05/2023
Pg No: 8 Ln No: 2 Pg No: 142 Ln No: 2
m) Manufacturing Agency: Advanced Flight Technologies n) Date, Month & Year December 2017
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: Yes p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 4675 Hrs / 1020 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Safety Critical
b) Defect Observed: Electronic warfare system false alerts. Abnormality observed during system test.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Improper calibration during last maintenance cycle
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Mission Computer component. Physical
examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.
c) Remedial Measures Adjust calibration settings to manufacturer specifications
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Update technical documentation with lessons learned
d) Attributable Code: N - Not established
Remarks: Detailed examination conducted. Corrective measures implemented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Design assessment confirms component operated within specified limits. Recommend enhanced inspection protocol.
Date: 09/06/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality assurance review completed. Recommend enhanced incoming inspection criteria for this component type.
Date: 10/06/2023 Signature: Dr. A.K. Sharma
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
User feedback incorporated. Recommend enhanced crew training on system operation and limitations.
Date: 14/06/2023 Signature: Air Cmde S.B. Rao
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality aspects from regulatory perspective reviewed. Investigation methodology is comprehensive and acceptable.
Date: 12/06/2023 Signature: Air Cmde S.B. Rao
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design authority review completed. Recommend continued airworthiness monitoring of affected component type.
Date: 14/06/2023 Signature: Eng. T.R. Menon
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
